messages.subject: Re: new!
messages.msgSnippet: ... Thanks for posting this Ren, I had forgotten I added my name there! Anyone else in MA?  (I sent a few messages to those who put they were unschoolers in MA
messages.messageBody:
"Ren Allen" <starsuncloud@...> wrote:
>>There is also a great locater at homeschoolmedia.com>>

Thanks for posting this Ren, I had forgotten I added my name there!

Anyone else in MA? (I sent a few messages to those who put they were
unschoolers in MA in my area - are you here? Don't know if they go
to individual email addresses, or just on the site....)
Jann

messages.subject: new!
messages.msgSnippet: Does anyone have that site that lists homeschoolers from everywhere? That would be an idea too. KELLY!!! Unschooling.info???;) There s a folder at
messages.messageBody:
"> Does anyone have that site that lists homeschoolers from
everywhere? That would be an idea too.>>"

KELLY!!! Unschooling.info???;)

There's a folder at unschooling.info specifically for contacting
unschoolers from all different places. There is also a great locater
at homeschoolmedia.com and nhen.org.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: new!
messages.msgSnippet: ... everywhere?  That would be an idea too. Try www.nhen.org, they list homeschool (though not specifically unschool) groups by state. Jann
messages.messageBody:
> Does anyone have that site that lists homeschoolers from
everywhere? That would be an idea too.>>

Try www.nhen.org, they list homeschool (though not specifically
unschool) groups by state.
Jann

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] new!
messages.msgSnippet: We just had the L&L conference in Fairview Heights, IL one year ago! You missed it! We went as a group to the City Museum and everything! There were several
messages.messageBody:
We just had the L&L conference in Fairview Heights, IL one year ago!
You missed it! We went as a group to the City Museum and everything!

There were several unschoolers from the immediate area---St Louis and
SW Illinois. I'd suggest googling "unschoolers St Louis Illinois" and
see what pops up. I know there is at least one group there.

Does anyone have that site that lists homeschoolers from everywhere?
That would be an idea too.


~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://liveandlearnconference.org

"It's a small world...but a BIG life!" ~Aaron McGlohn. aged 6

-----Original Message-----
From: thoscor@...

I have two sons 6 and 4. Are there any unschoolers in the St. Louis
area that
would like to connect? I love reading the posts but find it difficult
to put
into words my questions and to describe my situation and would like to
get
together with people who are choosing the same learning journey.

________________________________________________________________________
Check out AOL.com today. Breaking news, video search, pictures, email
and IM. All on demand. Always Free.

messages.subject: new!
messages.msgSnippet: Hi! I have two sons 6 and 4. Are there any unschoolers in the St. Louis area that would like to connect?  I love reading the posts but find it difficult to put
messages.messageBody:
Hi!
I have two sons 6 and 4. Are there any unschoolers in the St. Louis area that would like to connect? I love reading the posts but find it difficult to put into words my questions and to describe my situation and would like to get together with people who are choosing the same learning journey.
Thanks,
Cordelia


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
